Tucson makes his way over to the unconcious figure. Being an Autobot, he co=
uldn't resist the urge to help someone in need.  He kneels down, yet cautio=
usly looks around before doing anything, and also remembering that it was n=
ot wise to move an injured person, especially if they had any unknown fract=
ures.  His Sonar equipment scans the figure for fractures and injuries.  

=
"Hmmm...  Strange..  I better stay with this person to see if I get any sig=
ns of life."  

He rides the rail car, never leaving the figure's side.

--=
- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>=
 > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson knew that heading right into them would only put hi=
m in the same vunlerable position as Rodimus. If he is going to rescue him =
he knew he had to be careful as to how to approach the situation. He looks =
up at the rail car, and then to the insectile creatures with a calculating =
expression. He wasn't about to tell them what he was up to. And like a true=
 ninjabot, he crouches, builds up the energy in his legs, and then springs =
up with kinetic force, to attempt to grab onto the rail car to get him at l=
east away from the creatures to where he could plan his next move.
> >
> > =
"Not on my watch."
> >
> > Is the only word wispered from Tucson's mouth.
>=
 
> The creatures move in Tuscon's direction with a surprising speed and
> =
agility, their multiple legs giving them enhanced balance and
> stability. =
However just as they were about to reach Tuscon and sink
> their long claws=
 into him he leaped into the air! Grabbing on one
> handhold and then anoth=
er he leaped and swung and leaped again,
> quickly pulling and pushing hims=
elf in the direction of the
> magnetically powered rail-car above his head.=

> 
> A glance below him shows Tuscon that the insect-spider like creatures=

> are making no attempt to follow him, but they are watching the car as
> =
it travels.
> 
> Inside the car it appears well maintained. it is as if who=
 ever lived
> and worked here had only left a few hours ago, everything abo=
ut it was
> still clean, working and completely serviceable.
> 
> Inside th=
e car Tuscon can see a figure laying on the floor apparently
> unconscious =
shoved into a corner.
>
